fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3992].
  {panel}

	h3. Problem Description 

Only JIRA users who can create an issue via direct HTML link that will directly open _Create Issue_ page. However, it's not possible for SD customer to do the same and redirect it to Customer Portal. 
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/creating-issues-via-direct-html-links-159474.html 

h3. Suggested Resolution 

Provide a feature to create an issue via direct HTML link for SD customer that will redirect it to _Customer Portal_ page.
fields.summary: Create an issue via direct HTML link for SD customers
Need to reactivate our Jira website - payment information was not update by our account manager
PMKVY Certificates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3989].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the design for Approval/Decline button is separated from each other. The decline button is inside the *More* option. This does not feel natural.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the Decline button next to the Approve button to improve the user experience.
fields.summary: Approval/Decline Design Should be Improved
Customize what status to send the JIRA Service Desk CSAT
Hide permissions warning to all but administrators

fields.summary: Error Creating Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3983].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, the Knowledge Base articles from help center will be displayed in a new page with a smaller space to display the information when it's clicked. However, this may loose the content therefore impact the user experience.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Use the full page to display the KB article
* Add an option to allow user to open it in Confluence.
(i) This will also solve the problem with [Confluence doesn't display the content on a different site (in iframe)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-page-does-not-display-in-an-iframe-827335781.html] due to the *same-origin policy*.
fields.summary: Use full page to display knowledge base article

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3982].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

* If the customer changes the project key (following instructions here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/editing-a-project-key-776636293.html) then they cannot edit request groups because the database table references the old project key.
* The request should use the project ID, not the project key.

h3. Diagnostic

Making a request to {noformat}https://<instance-url>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<project-key>/groups{noformat} returns an HTTP Status Code of 400 and the following message: {noformat}{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"The Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist."}],"reasonKey":"AnErrorToServiceDeskHttpError..com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.errors.ServiceDeskError$$anon$1","reasonCode":"400"}{noformat}

You can confirm the problem by running the following query on the database and comparing the "KEY" value to that in the request above.

Query: {noformat}SELECT * FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT";{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a service desk project.
# Follow the steps to edit the project key here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/editing-a-project-key-776636293.html
# Go to Project Settings > Request Types
# Click "Edit Groups" on any of the Request Types listed.

h3. Workaround

We don't have any workarounds for this bug at the moment
fields.summary: Cannot edit request type groups for a project if the key has been changed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3980].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some customers who are both an Approver and a Service Desk Agent would like to be able to assign the Service Desk Request when they Approve/Deny the Request in one step
It appears that screens can be added to the transition, however they do not appear when the Approve/Deny buttons are used.  
!ApprovalTransition.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for Screens to be used on the Approve/Deny Transitions added by Service Desk 
 
h3. Workaround 
Current process is 2 Steps (Tested this workaround but it did not work):
- Approver clicks Approve/Deny (either in JIRA or Portal views)
- Agent/Collaborator clicks assign to assign Request to an Agent
fields.summary: Use Screens on Approve/Deny Service Desk Transitions
Eazybi addon is erroring out asking to update license though we have a valid license.
Request type issue since latest upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When accessing the Service Desk project administration as an agent, if you select the Queues option on the left hand menu, you will be able to see the queues available, if you try to delete by hovering the mouse over the queue selected and click on the "X" that will appear, it will not delete the queue, it will just show the loading icon, and stop it.

h3. Environment
Cloud environment
JIRA v1000.98.3
JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-16-002-D20160616T041347

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter in the project administration of a service desk project
# Select the Queues option on the left hand menu
# Try to delete a queue by hovering the mouse over it and clicking on the "X" button

h3. Expected Results
The queue should be deleted as stated on [Service Desk cloud documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-queues-for-your-team-777022236.html]

h3. Actual Results
The queue is not deleted and these logs are displayed:
Javascript console when reproducing the issue under the user profile:

{code}
 
h3. Notes
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-22 at 7.14.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

It's possible to rename the queue:

{quote}
1. Open the project with the related queue and click on Edit queue
2. Under "Issues to show" click on "Advanced"
3. Copy the string of text in the window
4. Go to a project with the default queues that you could not delete
5. Click on Edit queue for the queue that you want
6. Under "Issues to show" click on "Advanced"
7. Paste the string of text copied in the window.
8. Rename the queue name and save it{quote}
fields.summary: Not able to delete queues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3967].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
 On Jira Service Desk Automation rules, currently it isn’t possible to use variables to get ticket information in comments.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be very helpful to be able to use the ticket's information with the *Add comment* feature. That way we could refer to the persons name or build up a link, etc. through Automation.
 
Example:
{quote}Hello ${reporter.displayName},
 
Please click http://foobar/resolve?${issue.id} to resolve the issue. {quote}
This would be a simple text replacement and no scripting would be required hence security is still given.
h3. Why this is important
Further Automation options out of the box for users.
h3. Workaround
[Automation Lite for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.codebarrel.addons.automation.lite/cloud/overview] App has plenty of automation customization through triggers.
fields.summary: Allow ticket variables in comments for Automation
Confirm email address on activate account page
JSD docs need to mention customer context prominently

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3955].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two Service Desk projects, A and B, set both to "Only people on my customers list" under the "Manage who can raise requests through email and the customer portal" heading in Request Security settings.
# Create two new customer accounts in A, ensure they don't have access to B.
# Create a new issue in A, add both customer accounts to the Request Participants field in the new issue.
# Move the issue to Service Desk B.
# Edit the Request Participants field in on the moved issue, try to add another user (it can be anyone at all who _does_ have access to B).

The user in the last step is successfully added to the Request Participants field.

h3. Notes
This only happens if there's more than one user already in the Request Participants field who doesn't have access to the issue. If it's only a single user, the user added in Step 5 above overwrites the existing user.

h3. Workaround
Remove any users from the Request Participants field who don't have access to the project. An easy way to check is to compare who is in the Participants list on the customer portal view versus the standard JIRA issue view... users who don't have access will show in on the standard JIRA issue view but not the customer portal view.
fields.summary: Unable to add more participants if participants field contains customers who don't have access to a given Service Desk
silver stock issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3952].
  {panel}

The use case: A JIRA service desk agent wants to search requests containing the text "Client abc". 

Currently, they must either:

1. In the quick search field, type <Project Key> "client abc"
2. Open normal JIRA search and filter Project=<KEY> AND text ~ "Client abc"

This then takes them to search results for normal JIRA issues, and not the JIRA Service Desk. It is also annoying for the user to have to specify <Project Key> in all their searches. 

Having a text filter - like the search on the Agile backlog screen - would be more sensible in this situation - especially for users less familiar with JIRA (eg Business sales support).

And no, we shouldn't expect all JIRA Service Desk users to be JIRA super-users: that's the whole point of Service Desk- to make the interface easier. Else, we may as well use normal JIRA + board?
fields.summary: Add query/search filter to queues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3948].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using issue security in a Service Desk project, Request Participants are unable to view the issue at all

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Service Desk project
# Create a new Issue Security Scheme
# Create a new ticket and assign it the Issue Security level in your Issue Security Scheme
# Add a second user as a Request Participant on the ticket that is not part of the Issue Security Scheme
# That user should receive an email
# Click on the link in the email

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to view the ticket they are a Request Participant on

h3. Actual Results
The user can only see the main portal and not the issue he/she has been added as a Request Participant on

h3. Notes
In this use case, it would be helpful if there was a way to add a Request Participants group / role to the Issue Security Scheme so that when people are invited to partake in a ticket, they are able to see the ticket within the Service Desk project.
fields.summary: Allow Request Participants role / group to be added to Issue Security Schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3947].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a Service Desk customer is creating a ticket, he/she should be able to set the Issue Security level of the ticket

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a new project
# Create an issue security scheme
# Make sure the issue security field is on your create issue screen
# Attempt to create a new ticket as a service desk customer

h3. Expected Results
The Issue Security field should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The Issue Security field is not displayed at all

h3. Notes
There are use cases where Administrators would like their customers to be able to set the Issue Security level as they are special cases where the service desk customer knows the issue should only be viewable by certain people. Without this ability, a Service Desk Agent / Administrator must go in and edit the ticket manually.

h3.Workaround
The current work around is to either setup a specific request type that has the Issue Security value already defined or go in after the issue is created by the service desk customer and edit the Issue Security value manually.
fields.summary: Service Desk customers cannot edit the Issue Security field during issue creation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3943].
  {panel}

Problem:

We need to create dependencies between issues, we can mark the issues as "blockers" by linking the issues, although we can't actually block the issues from being closed.

{quote}I would like to know how to ensure that certain JIRA tasks can only be placed in the "Done" state when the task it depends on is in the "Done" state as well.
For instance, I have 3 tasks (task1, task2, task3). Task2 depends on task1, and task3 depends on task2. Meaning the order of execution should be task1, task2, and task3.{quote}

We Want:

Set dependencies between issues

Workaround:

Mark issues by linking the issues.
fields.summary: Create dependencies between issues

h3. Problem Definition

When configuring a SLA calendar, you are only able to add select dates as holidays. If you need to add a whole week to the holiday calendar (say from December 25 to January 1st), you need to add each day separately.

h3. Problem Definition

It currently is not possible to add or remove columns and filters on the "My Requests" page of the customer portal.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice if the My Request page could get customized, providing the ability to add or remove particular columns and filters.
 This would allow for customers to filter their requests more efficiently.


**

*UPDATE by [~6cf75f652d57]*

*We have released the following:* 
 # Jira Admins can remove any existing column in the request list page (customer portal) 
 # Jira Admins can add the following columns
 ## created date
 ## Updated date
 ## Due date
 ## Assignee
 ## Priority
 # Your *customers can now sort* on most of these columns. 

*How to do this:* 

If you are a Jira Admin, you can go to 'https://<your instance>/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?page=1', and click on the 'Customize' sidebar, you should be able to customize the columns that your customers see in this page. 

[Support Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/untitled-entry-2021-03-05-at-09-29-32/]
fields.summary: Ability to add/remove columns/filters in My Request page

h2.Summary

https://<CLOUD_INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10000/10000_Songs.txt

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3922].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Updated 15th June 2016}
Hi all,

Due to popular demand for functionality to turn off the pre-populate commenting feature and the low usage we experience with this feature we have decided to remove this feature from JIRA Service Desk. We understand some of you who use this feature regularly will be upset but based on our usage analytics only 0.05% of our comments made have used this feature. Rather then continue to add complexity to JIRA Service Desk by adding more controls to toggle this feature, we believe it is better to remove this feature completely.

If you really do want a similar functionality back I will recommend voting on the ticket: [JSD-631| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631] Auto reply template feature, where we will be able to model similar behaviour and experience with canned responses.

-- JIRA Service Desk team

{panel}

We appreciate your patience, entirely understand this is important to you and do want to provide a solution but need to do the appropriate discovery and prioritisation before we can make a commitment here.
Best regards,
Jehan

Jehan Gonsalkorale

  {panel}

h3. Summary
We should have a comparison document that shows the Pro's and Con's of using a JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler compared to a JIRA Mail Handler.

Some areas that could be covered:
- User Experience/Interface for JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler is tailored for JIRA Service Desk Experience
- How The Mail handler reacts to an Unknown User E-mailing JIRA. 
- Service Desk Mail Handler does not delete E-mails, and the JIRA mail handler does.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
No known documentation exists.


h3. Expected Results
Something that clearly explains the differences in the Mail Handler would help our customers make better use of the products.


h3. Actual Results
Customers Experience is to look at: 
- [Receiving requests by email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Receiving+requests+by+email] 
- [Creating Issues and Comments from Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email]

Amongst other documentation to try to assemble a good understanding of the functionality.


h3. Notes
It would be also good to update the Documentation to be more explicit about the fact different 'Mail Handlers' Exist.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Mail Handling Comparison to JIRA Mail Handling

h3. *Summary*

As of JSD 3.1.0-OD-01, the portal view was changed when viewing all potential service desks. No longer are descriptions of all present service desks, rather, a list of popular / recent service desks exists now.


h3. *Environment*

JSD Cloud 3.1.0-OD-01
JSD Server 3.1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two or more Service Desks
# View all available portals by loading https://instancename.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals


h3. *Expected Results*

A list of all portals with descriptions should be visible


h3. *Actual Results*

A list of popular and recent portals is displayed

 
h3. *Notes*

With this new view, it leaves a lot of guess work on the part of the user / customer. While there is a search available, the user / customer may not know what he / she is searching for.


h3. *Workaround*

This can currently be disabled as pointed out in the support readiness document Support Readiness - Smart Portal

*TURN ON the sd.global.portal.rt.search.disabled dark feature. The portal will revert back to the old design.*

*NOTE* Disabled the Smart Portal renders the Customize button unusable.
fields.summary: Smart portal does not allow for displaying of portal descriptions when viewing all available Service Desk portals

Sample scenario:

One service desk have 20 request types.
10 of them are assigned to specialist A
5 to specialist to specialist B
5 to specialist to specialist C

I suggest to add smth like 'Technician Availability Chart' or calendar.
If a specialist is not available on a specific date range - you can mark it in calendar. As an option - you can choose a Backup Technician rule for this period.

- Assign to following technician
- Don't take any action on the requests.

h3. Problem Definition

Currently we can set a ServiceDesk project to be only available for "people on my customers list can raise a request" in Request Security section. 
This makes that specific project unavailable (blocked) permanently. 
Having such option can help customers to access the hidden project(s) using the direct link of the project somewhere else other than customer portal. 

h3. Suggested Resolution
To provide an option in project level, on Customer portal settings to show or hide specific project on Help Center
fields.summary: Having An Option To Show/Hide SD Project On Customer Portal Help Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3856].
  {panel}

*+Problem Definition+*

as described on the following page automation can only be run as user who is defined as project default or a user who triggered the rule:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/automating-your-service-desk-732528900.html

We currently created a user "Support Desk User" to trigger our rules.
We don´t want the assignee to be the trigger because we don´t want to confuse the customer with automatic comments.
They must see that this kind of comment is an automation.

*+Current Workaround+*
We created a new "Support Desk User" inside crowd and added him to a agent specific group.
Our way ends up in consuming one Agent license for automating comments and does not work as intended.

*+How do we use those automatic comments?+*
- As you can see in our example Workflow we have a step called Freezed. 
- Behind this Freezed Status we have defined a SLA which counts 15 Business Days. After that this specific Issue will be "Reopened".
That means it goes from "Freezed" -> "Waiting for Customer" -> "Waiting for Support"
What we had here was a comment for the customer which said that this issue was unfreezed and that the support will stay in contact with the customer here. If this comment is provided by the "Support Desk User" the trigger will automatically move the issue back to "Waiting for Customer" because this rule was triggered by an agent.
 !example_Workflow.png|thumbnail! 

*+Suggested Solution+*
Provide a functional only user or another way that can be used for running automation inside the Service Desk without consuming an agent license or the need of the assignee to trigger it.
fields.summary: Provide a functional only user that can be used for running automated process

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the design for Approval/Decline button is separated from the comments. If a user adds a comment and clicks on approve/decline, the comment will be lost as the page is refreshed. The issue is transitioned but no comments would be added.
h3. Suggested Solution
# Use the functionality of a JIRA transition screen where if a an issue is transitioned, a screen to displayed to select required fields and add a comment. Click on add will save the comment and transition the issue.
# Add a warning if the comment is not added and Approve/Decline is selected, the comment will be lost.

h3. Workaround
Add a comment separately from Approving/Declining the request.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3851].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
In JIRA Service Desk, there are chances that customers' accounts are stored in both writable and read-only user directories. In these cases, it's unwise to enable External User Management as customers with writable accounts can't reset passwords themselves. However, customers with read-only accounts, upon requesting a password reset, receive an email asking them to contact JIRA admins. This causes overhead to admin tasks.

h4. +Suggestion+
It would be great if JIRA admins can customize the Forgot Password page in a way that:
# customers with writable accounts can still request a password reset link via email
# customers with read-only accounts:
#* will be redirected to a relevant page (decided by JIRA admins) where they know how to proceed
_OR_
#* presented with a message including a link to that page
_OR_
#* the email content sent to them can be customized to include a link to that page
fields.summary: Ability to customize Forgot Password page to address customers from a read-only directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3843].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When sending an email to a Service Desk mail handler with issue key from other project (i.e JIRA SW project) entered in subject line, the email would get rejected and Service Desk mail log will state that "*Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist*".

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0-OD-11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in JIRA SW project. (i.e SW-123)
# Create a Service Desk project. (i.e SD project)
# Enable email request in Service Desk project
# Enter the issue key you've created in JIRA SW project (SW-123), in the subject line of your mail and then send it to the Service Desk mail


h3. Expected Results
- A new Service Desk issue will be created as the issue key entered in the subject line doesn't exist in the Service Desk project.

h3. Actual Results
- Service Desk project would reject that ticket and state that the "*Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist*". Somehow, it searches for the issue key even from other projects.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk mail handler rejects any email with issue key from other projects entered in the subject line.

h3. Problem Definition

In Server, if you want to blocklist a spam email, then you have to mark it as spam from the mail server itself. However, in Cloud there is no access to the server itself to block email addresses because they are owned by Atlassian.
h3. Suggestion

Allow JIRA admins to set emails as spam from JIRA Service Desk itself, by having a list of blocked email addresses.
h3. Workaround

Use a different email address with your custom domain to control blocked email addresses from the server end.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

A feature request was raised and implemented about this feature:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1699

The recent update for JSD Cloud, ithis feature is now disabled due to it's creating unsolicited notifications as outlined at [What's new page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New]
{quote}
11 May 2016 -- Important Note:
We’re aware that the participants feature in JIRA Service Desk has been inadvertently creating unsolicited notifications. To address this we have implemented the following changes:
- Disabled invitation of new customers via email To/Cc fields, so only existing customers (i.e. those with an account on JIRA Service Desk) can be invited as a participant to a ticket.
- Limited the invitation of new customers to 5 at one time via the “Add People” option when customers add participants via the Help Center. There is no limit on the total number of participants that can be on a ticket.
{quote}

If an existing JSD customer CC a new customer, this new customer will *not* be added as a request participant. It requires manual work by manually adding the new customer in the list of JSD customer list. Most of the time, users may not know which new email address that their customers are adding in CC field.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to disable or enable this feature.
fields.summary: an option to automatically add new customers in CC field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3805].
  {panel}

As a project administrator I'd like the ability to disable the email notification a requested participant receives when they have been added as a requested participant.  

Background:
At my company a number of our infrastructure teams are looking to leverage JIRA Service Desk to communicate change and outage updates to a broad audience.  The workflow is; A ticket is created and classified accordingly.  Impacted teams or department emails/distribution lists are added as requested participants.  The team then uses the "share with customer" comment to send out 'public' updates.  Anyone on the teams can submit feedback via the ticket.  

The functionality of the requested participant is working our really well for our teams,  however there have been requests to disable this initial email notifying a requested participant that they have been added.  Blasting large email lists with this email seems redundant in this case.  Seeing as we're blasting emails to such a large number of people the teams want to make sure the communication is tightly controlled so that it doesn't become noise.

In projects where requested participants are individuals and will probably be more active we'd like to keep the email settings as is.  Changes and outages are contained in their own project and we'd want the ability to only disable the email notification only on that project.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the you have added as a request participant email notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3804].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When customer has set "Anyone can create a customer request via email" it is not possible to set a default reporter for the tickets raised from an unknown email address.
One use case is to notify the default reporter that a new ticket from an unknown address has been created so the default reporter can reassign it to a registered user if the customer has sent the message from an unregistered address or to forward the ticket that were sent to the service desk by mistake to the right department.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option when activating "Anyone can create a customer request via email" : When creating a ticket from an unknown address, user can choose whether to create the ticket with a default reporter or with a new user.
fields.summary: Ability to set 'Default Reporter' instead of creating new users in email channel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3801].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Based on the 'Showing last 7 days' statement via {{SD project > Reports > SLA goals}}, it's mentioned the calculation will based on the last 7 days but in fact not. Basically, the SLAs report is calculating for ongoing tickets even if it's from a month ago are still relevant to that SLA's success. After chat with Albert Wang, this is an expected behaviour based on the code design. 

!last_7_days.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

* We understand the SLA formula but the wording can be more meaningful such as 'Showing last 7 days and ongoing issues' or any wording that would explain the SLA formula.

 
h3. Workaround 

Add a custom JQL query for the last 7 days issues.
fields.summary: Change the wording of 'Showing last 7 days' in SLA Goals
